remarks: A standard textbook definition of a topological space ` <. A , J >. ` : a topology on ` A ` is a collection ` J ` of subsets of ` A ` such that ` (/) ` and ` A ` are in ` J ` and that is closed under union and finite intersection.  Definition of topological space in [Munkres] p. 76. (Contributed by NM, 19-Jul-2006.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
istps5OLD $p |- ( <. A , J >. e. TopSpOLD <-> ( ( A. x e. J x C_ A /\ (/) e. J /\ A e. J ) /\ ( A. x ( x C_ J -> U. x e. J ) /\ A. x ( ( x C_ J /\ x =/= (/) /\ x e. Fin ) -> |^| x e. J ) ) ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d J x $.
